Jesus Was an Example of Contented Industry.--It requires much more grace and stern discipline of character to work for God in the capacity of mechanic, merchant, lawyer, or farmer, carrying the precepts of Christianity into the ordinary business of life, than to labor as an acknowledged missionary in the open field, where one's position is understood and half its difficulties obviated by that very fact. It requires strong spiritual nerve and muscle to carry religion into the workshop 
                                                                           359
and business office, sanctifying the details of everyday life, and ordering every worldly transaction to the standard of a Bible Christian.
